item.title: 加拿大银行调查显示企业无法摆脱贸易悲观情绪
item.description: 加拿大银行对企业的调查显示，尽管企业对通胀的预期有所缓解，但仍担心持续的贸易战会限制其销售。【原文：The Bank of Canada’s survey of businesses shows firms are still worried the ongoing trade war will limit their sales, though their expectations for inflation eased.】

item.title: 停摆僵局让美国 IPO 持币观望者不再观望
item.description: 尽管政府停摆问题挥之不去，但准备在美国上市的公司仍在大力推进非常规的 IPO 计划，这让华尔街的许多人大吃一惊。【原文：Companies on deck to go public in the US are powering forward with unconventional IPO plans despite the lingering government shutdown, taking many on Wall Street by surprise.】

item.title: 巴拿马将在科布雷铜矿谈判中坚持资源所有权
item.description: 巴拿马财政部长在接受采访时说，巴拿马将要求任何重启价值 100 亿美元的 Cobre Panama 铜矿的协议都必须明确规定该国是土地和资源的所有者。【原文：Panama will require that any agreement to restart the $10 billion Cobre Panama copper mine clearly stipulates that the country is the owner of the land and the resources, the country’s finance chief said in an interview.】

item.title: 马斯克薪酬遭更多反对，Glass Lewis 敦促投 "反对 "票
item.description: 第二家主要代理顾问公司敦促特斯拉公司股东投票反对首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）1 万亿美元的薪酬方案，为这家汽车制造商董事会争取投资者支持增添了潜在障碍。【原文：Tesla Inc. shareholders are being urged by a second major proxy adviser to vote against Chief Executive Officer Elon Musk’s $1 trillion compensation package, adding to potential hurdles as the carmaker’s board works to secure investor support.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚与美国冲突升级有可能破坏债券涨势
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普指责哥伦比亚总统古斯塔沃-佩特罗是 "非法毒品头目"，引发了对经济报复的担忧，哥伦比亚美元债券周一全线下跌，挫伤了近期的涨势。【原文：Colombian dollar bonds fell across the curve on Monday, denting their recent rally, after US President Donald Trump accused his counterpart Gustavo Petro of being an “illegal drug leader,” triggering fears of economic retaliation.】

item.title: 埃塞俄比亚与中国商谈将美元贷款兑换成人民币事宜
item.description: 埃塞俄比亚开始与中国谈判，将其欠中国政府的 53.8 亿美元中的至少一部分转换成人民币贷款，以肯尼亚为榜样，支持中国将其货币国际化的努力。【原文：Ethiopia started talks with China to convert at least part of the $5.38 billion it owes Beijing into yuan-denominated loans, following an example set by Kenya that bolsters China’s efforts to internationalize its currency.】

item.title: Truist 寻求在地区银行担忧之际出售高等级债券
item.description: Truist Financial Corp. 周一开始出售投资级债券，上周对一些地区性银行亏损的担忧曾短暂地引发了更广泛的信贷担忧。【原文：Truist Financial Corp. kicked off a sale of investment-grade bonds Monday, after concern last week about losses at some regional banks briefly stoked broader credit worries.】

item.title: 电池制造商继续推进海外业务，CATL 利润增长 41
item.description: 当代安培瑞斯科技有限公司（Amperex Technology Co.作为全球最大的电动汽车电池制造商，该公司第三季度利润大幅增长，巩固了在中国市场的领先地位，并进一步进军海外市场。【原文：Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd.’s profit jumped in the third quarter, as the world’s largest maker of electric vehicle batteries defended its lead in China and pushed further into overseas markets.】

item.title: Oura 为其智能戒指准备了类似 Apple Watch 的高血压检测功能
item.description: 芬兰智能戒指制造商 Oura Health Oy 是最近一家寻求进军血压监测领域的可穿戴设备公司。【原文：Oura Health Oy, the Finnish smart ring maker, is the latest wearable company seeking to move into blood pressure monitoring.】

item.title: 波兰图书和音乐零售商 Empik 据称计划在华沙首次公开募股
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，波兰图书、音乐和学校用品零售商 Empik SA 计划明年在华沙证券交易所进行首次公开募股。【原文：Polish book, music and school supply retailer Empik SA is planning an initial public offering on the Warsaw Stock Exchange next year, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 苹果接近历史新高，因为 Loop 认为 iPhone 需求有 25% 的上升空间
item.description: 在 Loop Capital 将苹果公司股票评级从 "持有 "上调至 "买入 "后，苹果公司股价周一开盘将接近历史最高水平。【原文：Apple Inc. shares are poised to open near record levels on Monday after Loop Capital upgraded the stock to buy from hold, the latest firm to cite more positive iPhone demand trends.】

item.title: 阿根廷中央银行与美国财政部签署 200 亿美元互换协议
item.description: 阿根廷货币管理局周一在一份新闻稿中宣布，阿根廷央行与美国财政部签署了一项 200 亿美元的互换额度协议。【原文：Argentina’s central bank and the US Treasury have signed a swap line agreement for $20 billion, the monetary authority announced in a press release Monday.】

item.title: 受特朗普与习近平会晤猜测影响，大豆攀升至一个月高点
item.description: 芝加哥大豆期货连续第三个交易日上涨，原因是市场猜测美国总统唐纳德-特朗普和中国国家主席习近平可能在未来几周内举行会晤，这助长了对全球最大的两个经济体之间恢复农产品贸易的乐观情绪。中国国内生产总值（GDP）走强也为大豆价格提供了支撑。【原文：Soybean futures rose for a third consecutive session in Chicago amid speculation that US president Donald Trump and China’s president Xi Jinping could meet in the coming weeks, fueling optimism over renewed agricultural trade between the world’s two largest economies. Prices were also supported by stronger Chinese GDP.】

item.title: 英国反垄断监管机构批准 Worldpay 的全球支付交易
item.description: 世界支付公司（Worldpay）以 243 亿美元与全球支付公司（Global Payments Inc.【原文：Worldpay’s $24.3 billion deal with Global Payments Inc. to create a payment processing behemoth avoided a deeper investigation as the UK watchdog found the deal will not weaken competition in the UK.】

item.title: 认为找工作很难？试试在简历上写上 "DEI "吧
item.description:
就在几年前，多元化专业人士还是美国企业界的抢手货。现在，许多人发现自己正在为工作而挣扎。【原文：

Diversity professionals were hot commodities in corporate America just a few years ago. Many now find themselves struggling for work. 

】

item.title: 美国贸易战持续发酵，加拿大人对经济日益悲观
item.description: 由于与美国的贸易战愈演愈烈，加拿大人对经济越来越不乐观，给一系列关键行业带来了压力。【原文：Canadians are increasingly downbeat on the economy as a trade war with the US grinds on, putting pressure on a range of key industries.】

item.title: 供应增加，航程延长，海上石油运输量再创新高
item.description: 由于产量不断增加，出口国和进口国之间的距离越来越远，货物在海上航行的时间也越来越长，因此全球海洋上的原油运输量持续增加。【原文：The amount of crude being hauled across the world’s oceans continues to increase, as rising production and greater distances between exporters and importers keeps cargoes at sea for longer.】

item.title: 高盛高级银行家迈克尔-马什将在工作近 20 年后退休
item.description: 高盛集团（Goldman Sachs Group Inc.【原文：One of Goldman Sachs Group Inc.’s most prominent London-based investment bankers, Michael Marsh, is set to depart the bank.】

item.title: 巴西交易所仓库库存减少，咖啡上涨
item.description: 阿拉比卡咖啡期货跳涨，因为巴西在交易所监测仓库中的库存降至五年来的最低水平。【原文：Arabica coffee futures jumped as Brazilian stocks in exchange-monitored warehouses fell to the lowest level in five years.】

item.title: 摩洛哥承诺在青年领导的抗议活动后提供 150 亿美元的社会开支
item.description: 在青年领导的反对 2030 年国际足联世界杯开支的抗议浪潮之后，摩洛哥正计划增加明年的社会服务预算。【原文：Morocco is planning to increase next year’s budget for social services, following a wave of youth-led protests against spending for the 2030 FIFA World Cup.】

item.title: 特朗普的免税店人工智能热潮在低迷的全球经济中悄然兴起
item.description: 在上周举行的国际货币基金组织和世界银行年会上，一个持续的主题是全球经济对特朗普关税冲击的韧性。对此有无数种解释，从价格的延迟传导到越来越多的 "例外"，再到现在臭名昭著的 "TACO市场"。【原文：One persistent theme at last week’s International Monetary Fund and World Bank annual meetings was the resilience of the global economy to the Trump tariff shock. For which there are myriad explanations, from the delayed pass-through in prices to a growing list of carveouts to the now infamous TACO market meme.】

item.title: 德克萨斯州石油人捕捉到核新技术的商机
item.description:
人们正急于将小型下一代反应堆作为满足蓬勃发展的电力需求的一种方式。【原文：

There’s a rush toward small next-generation reactors as a way to satisfy booming power demand. 

】

item.title: 摩根士丹利的威尔逊表示，现在给股票 "放行 "为时尚早
item.description: 摩根士丹利（Morgan Stanley）的迈克尔-威尔逊（Michael Wilson）认为，股市仍面临着贸易紧张局势和盈利修正放缓等尚未解决的风险，这应使投资者在短期内保持谨慎。【原文：Equity markets still face unresolved risks around trade tensions and slowing earnings revisions, which should keep investors cautious in the near-term, according to Morgan Stanley’s Michael Wilson.】

item.title: 国防科技初创企业将目光转向太空战
item.description: 欢迎收看《深度科技》（Tech In Depth），这是彭博社全球记者关于科技商业的每日时事通讯。今天，埃德-勒德洛（Ed Ludlow）将与太空科技初创公司的高管们聊聊他们公司与美国军方的合作。【原文：Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ed Ludlow talks with executives at space tech startups about their companies’ work with the US military.】

item.title: 亚马逊快递公司在成本上升、利润微薄的情况下纷纷倒闭
item.description: 2022 年，杰克-克莱（Jake Clay）从朋友那里听说了亚马逊公司支持的机会后，在得克萨斯州奥德萨市创办了一家亚马逊快递公司。他投入了 7.5 万美元，第一年就赚了 20 多万美元。作为一名空军退伍军人，50 岁的克雷感觉自己加入了一支精英部队。【原文：In 2022, Jake Clay started an Amazon delivery firm in Odessa, Texas, after hearing about the company-backed opportunity from a friend. He sank $75,000 into the business and earned more than $200,000 in the first year. An Air Force veteran, Clay, 50, felt like he’d joined an elite unit.】

item.title: 中国描绘未来五年发展蓝图
item.description: 我是马尔科姆-斯科特，驻悉尼的国际经济编辑。今天我们关注中国的下一个五年计划。请将反馈和建议发送至 ecodaily@bloomberg.net。如果您还没有注册，请点击这里。【原文：I’m Malcolm Scott, international economics editor in Sydney. Today we’re looking at China’s next five-year plan. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.】

item.title: Revolut 获准在墨西哥开展银行业务
item.description: Revolut 有限公司获准在墨西哥开展银行业务，与 Nu 控股有限公司和 MercadoLibre 公司在拉美地区的金融科技竞争进入白热化阶段，这是该公司本月在该地区获得的第二张监管绿灯。【原文：Revolut Ltd was cleared to start its banking operation in Mexico, heating up the fintech race with Nu Holdings Ltd and MercadoLibre Inc in Latin America as it receives its second regulatory green light in the region this month.】

item.title: 欧洲汽车需求放缓，Stellantis 首席执行官将与意大利工会会面
item.description: Stellantis NV 首席执行官 Antonio Filosa 周一将与意大利工会会面，因为需求疲软促使这家菲亚特和阿尔法-罗密欧汽车制造商暂停几家工厂的生产。【原文：Stellantis NV Chief Executive Officer Antonio Filosa is meeting with Italian labor unions on Monday as weak demand prompts the maker of Fiat and Alfa Romeo cars to pause output at several factories.】

item.title: 瑞典山特维克创纪录，黄金反弹推动订单增加
item.description: 由于金价和铜价反弹推动了对采矿设备和服务的需求，山特维克公司第三季度订单高于预期，股价创下历史新高。【原文：Sandvik AB’s shares rose to a record on higher-than-expected third-quarter orders as a rally in gold and copper prices drove demand for mining equipment and services.】

item.title: 泰国为与柬埔寨的争端带来的 31 亿美元损失做好准备
item.description: 泰国总理阿努丁-占维拉库（Anutin Charnvirakul）的政府预测，今年早些时候，一场长期的领土争端爆发为武装冲突，与柬埔寨的跨境贸易中断可能造成总额达 1,000 亿泰铢（约合 31 亿美元）的损失。【原文：Thai Prime Minister Anutin Charnvirakul’s government predicts losses could total 100 billion baht ($3.1 billion) from disruptions to cross-border trade with Cambodia, after a longstanding territorial dispute erupted into armed conflict earlier this year.】
